intro: Verbascum kickxianum, commonly known as the Kashmir mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are broad and covered in soft, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Verbascum kickxianum is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat respiratory ailments.
